Understate: The claim may understate the number of public-sector jobs and minimum-wage jobs created in Texas.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that "most" of the 850,000 jobs were public-sector and minimum-wage jobs.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of public-sector and minimum-wage jobs is a negative aspect of the Texas economy.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the increase in public-sector and minimum-wage jobs, such as population growth or changes in industry composition.
